title: Line of Duty's Stephen Graham opens up about suicide attempt and bad depression
text:

Line of Duty star Stephen Graham has opened up about suffering from depression and attempting suicide.

This actor, who is also known for his role in This Is England, struggled with his mental health in his early 20s and tried to take his own life.

The 46-year-old told The Sunday Times : "In my early twenties, I suffered from really bad depression and tried to take my own life once.

"Thankfully, the rope snapped and I’m here today.

"But I know the loneliness, isolation and feeling you can’t cope in the world."

Thankfully, Stephen was able to recover from the tumultuous time in his life.

(Image: BBC)

(Image: Keith Mayhew/SOPA Images/REX)

He went on to secure some huge roles, including parts in big movies like Gangs of New York and Martin Scorsese's The Irishman, in which he stars alongside Robert De Niro and Al Pacino.

Although he's previously admitted that the amazing roles he secures are partly down to his wife, Hannah Walters.

Stephen is dyslexic and enlists the help of his actress wife, who also starred in This Is England and appears in Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Men Tell No Tales, to read his scripts for him and tell him which parts he should accept.

(Image: FilmMagic)

He said: "I’m dyslexic so I struggle. My missus actually reads the script and says whether or not I’m doing it. She’s made some good choices.

"I have to read it and read it and read it, then make it look like it’s the first time I’m saying it."

* Samaritans (116 123) operates a 24-hour service available every day of the year. If you prefer to write down how you’re feeling, or if you’re worried about being overheard on the phone, you can email Samaritans at jo@samaritans.org
description: The actor, who is also known for his role in This Is England, opened up about the dark times he's been through and attempting to take his own life
